snippet: A sale of Indian artifacts was conducted in Paris on Friday, amid protests, after a judge ruled that the auction could go forward.
abstract: Contested auction of sacred Hopi Indian artifacts is conducted in Paris after judge rules that it can go forward; auction generates more than $1 million in sales, despite presence of protesters inside and outside auction house who urged patrons not to take part.
lead_paragraph: A sale of Indian artifacts was conducted in Paris on Friday, amid protests, after a judge ruled that the auction could go forward.

headline.seo: Hopi Artifacts Are Sold by Néret-Minet Tessier & Sarrou
headline.main: Protested Sale of Hopi Works Brings $1.2 Million
headline.print_headline: Protested Sale of Hopi Works Brings $1.2 Million
